cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward southeast Louisiana and the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (Intracoastal City–Mouth of the Pearl River area, near Morgan City/Houma)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA, to the MS/AL border including Vermilion Bay, Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA, to the Mouth of the Pearl River including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through coastal Mississippi/Alabama, with highest impacts in southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (79%) of tropical-storm-force winds, 47% chance of 50-kt winds, and up to 21% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds near the port late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Lake Maurepas surge forecast 3–5 ft with water level rises possible up the Mississippi River toward the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with locally up to 20 inches possible, creating considerable flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rapid river rises, flash flooding, dangerous currents, and isolated tornadoes in rain bands.
